description: Go here for lunch quite a bit.  It's cheap.  Less than 6 bucks for lunch, including tax.  The food is not the best, but good enough for lunch, especially for 6 dollars.  I like the chinese brocolli and beef, and the black bean sauce chow fun.
author: Tinou B.

description: This is your basic Chinese restaurant, but I like it for the huge portions and great prices.  Yesterday I ordered two dishes and rice and that was enough to feed three friends and still have leftovers.  Their meat dishes are mostly meat, few veggies, which a nice surprise...many other places I've been to have more onions and bell peppers and other fillers than there is meat.  I like their Mongolian Chicken and Malaysian Style Chow Fun.  Service is ok...they aren't overly friendly here and you may have to wave your arm a little to get someone's attention.  If you order food to go, they'll have it ready in 10 min, which is nice.
author: Swirls L.

description: Cheap Chinese food on Clement. All dishes are around $6, if not less. Some specials are even $3.85. Great place to go with non-picky friends who are looking for cheap good food. It may not always be the cleanest and friendliest and you may not always be able to decipher the specials written in chinese, but thats what a lot of true asian places are about. When I'm looking for guaranteed service and clean bathrooms, I go to PF Changs. Okay, maybe not, but you get the picture.
author: Kim C.

description: Cheap Chinese food, which is reasonable quality and plus their open until pretty late.
author: David M.

description: food there are good and cheap sometimes find a hair or bug in your food. WHo doesn't? always pack during the weekend whenever me and my friends try to go there. portion is juss enough.
author: Lily T.

description:
After the *HORRID* experience at Chapeau!, M and I drove around looking for something eat as we were both starving. 

Given that it was after 10PM at this point, there were not a lot of places open. China First was one of three restaurants that looked to be open. 

We ended up ordering the black pepper beef, beef with crispy noodles, chicken wings and scallop fried rice. This was more than enough for 2 meals and only cost $24. Great deal!

We'll go back again. 3 1/2 stars.
author: Jauder H.

description:
Another local favorite that is literally a hole in the wall kind of place.  Let's get this straight first: Chinese restaurants with nice ambience always overcharge way too much for Chinese food.  I avoid these places like a plague because it's not worth it.  Chinese food isn't and shouldn't be fine dining and anyone trying present it as such is ripping you off.   Chinese food is homely and my soul food.  I come for the food.  

Things you have to order:  

Salt and Pepper crab
Clay Pot Rice
Anything else

The clay pot rice is something you will not find in the menu.  It's only written on the wall but it's in Chinese.  Just ask them about it and they'll explain it to you.  Basically, it's rice that's cooked slowly in a clay pot with preserved meats such as frog legs, sausage (pork or chicken).  The rice soaks up the flavors of the meat and is really tasty.  It takes a while to make so I usually order it first thing when I get there.  

All of the other food is solid, home cooked stuff.  It's very inexpensive and has great food.  I highly recommend this place and I don't recommend a lot of Chinese restaurants.  This one stands out from the rest.
author: Scott L.

description: I don't know how 'authentic' this is but it was really tasty and very affordable. My family wanted good cheap Chinese to take to the park...we spent about $25 on 4 big portions plus rice. Ordered by phone after looking at a menu online. Food was ready on time and darn good, everyone agreed.
author: Lee S.

description: I love the cheapness. It's not quality but who cares? They also have some interesting dishes that I've never tried before.
author: Alex Y.

description: This place is your typical Chinese restaurant that serves an inexpensive menu. The difference it that the food is good and filling. Most Chinese restaurants are cheap and effective but China First is actually good. Hop tow ha is good, the pork chop dishes are good, and everything else is pretty good too. Been here twice and so far so good.
author: Gordon L.

description: I came here with my lion dance friends after a practice for late night dinner (1030pm). For $28, you get a good meal for 4-5 people. Delicious and filling.
author: Jason C. J.

description: I'm chinese.  Therefore I'd like to think I know a little about good chinese food.  The things chinese people look for in a restaurant are...1. good food - 2. good prices - 3. good menu - 4. good location.  Notice that service didn't make the list?  China First scores decently in all those areas (except location, too bad it's not closer to my house).  Their set menus are a really good deal.  They also have a list of dishes that are $3.88 each.  Why $3.88 and not $3.89?  8 is a good luck number is my guess.  Anyway, the eggplant with pork on the 3.88 list was really good.  The other stuff I've had there, the fried rice, the tofu and pea shoots, the seafood soup, the salt-n-peppa chicken wings...all good.
author: Ming L.

description:
Okay, so my family and I usually come to this place at least, AT LEAST 1 time a week. I really don't care for this restaurant, but I really don't mind eating here...Okay, I actually do. The food is mediocre, the service is not so great, the parking is also a bitc%... what else is there...? LIST!

1. Whenever I usually come here we get the welcoming from the waiters because apparently, they know my family, so we get seated really fast so that's a plus.
2. Here comes the nasty part! They do not look at how dirty the tables and the spinning thing really is! They just wipe it down and consider that clean... are you serious?! and they don't even bother to check the utensils before handing them to us... one time I found a piece of rice stuck between the end of the forks! Can you talk about cleanliness?! The plates and cups usually have a stain on them as well, they seriously do not clean the utensils very good... and omg, if you need to use the restroom, I advise you to just HOLD IT! Escpially if you are a female, I believe you wouldnt you want to sit on this toilet seat that has pee all over it, I WOULDN'T... the bathroom stinks so bad, smells like pee and poo mixed. so lets just stay away from that okay? good. Next, the big tank of fish that they have at the back, they really don't make the fish looks so tempting to eat, honestly they just have fish in there just floating looking like they are dead. seriously. At least make it look tempting and wipe the glasses so everyone can clearly see what they are about to put into the mouths! NEXT TOPIC! If there was a category for cleanliness on this it would recieve a " NEGATIVE 3 "
3. The parking on clement street is usually crazy and can you rarely ever find parking. There are also so many double parked cars in this area and the asian drivers that don't give a flying F%%% about the drivers behind loves to drive slow for their own benefits looking for parking. talk about A-HOLES?!
4. okay, down to the good stuff. The food here is just mediocre but they actually have really good dishes. Dishes that I always order here is the Lettuce wraps with minced chicken, the deep fried sandad is so good... im not even kidding SO GOOD, the crispy skin and the tender fish meat YUM! The oysters are really tasty as well, with the black bean topping it comes with makes it have a really nice bitter taste to it, but a good taste. So overall the foods can be really great, but they can also be really bad, My personal dislikes are the sweet and sour pork, Ew... it has a nasty stench to them it makes me want to trhow up whenever they are near me. Also the salt and peper shrimp aren't as great as the salt and pepper chicken wings*!

* A MUST HAVE.

Overall, this place is inexpensive, and great for having a large group of 10-15, the food isn't bad nor great. Don't be suprised if you find leftover food on your table. so... 3 stars for me.
author: Johnny T.

description: So when heartache, stomach ache or hangover hit, I call up China First for some shrimp jook (or porridge as I consistently have to correct myself.)  It's not on the menu, but they cook it up in 10 to 15 minutes and I walk out the door for about $6 (including tip) with more boiling hot comfort than I know what to do with.  It's the best I've found west of Chinatown.  I've also done several sit-downs here:  the portions are huge, the prices are minimal and the food is always delicious.
author: Jasmine L.

description: It's not the worst place but it isn't the best. You just have to know what to order. I always go with Chinese friends because they know what to order, and it usually isn't on the menu. Their fried fish with soy sauce is really good and I like their spicy tofu. I recommend the egg plant and bok choy. One veggie I like is called Dou Miao, it's like nothing I've ever seen or tasted. It's not on the menu and a bit pricy but worth it.
author: Salma L.

description: Cheap Chinese food . About $200 was plenty than enough to fill up the 11 of us . My parents are super close with the owners here . I really like their clay pot rice . The stuff that was in it was really good too .. not too salty . The chicken in the rice was kind of flavorless but nonetheless soft . Their greens are also really good . They are very green and full of flavor !! It's not all oily and salty like how other restaurants make them . Their chicken is also good .. very fresh . I'm not really a big fan of seafood but that is what this place is well known for . The bathroom is very dirty btw .
author: Eileen L.

description: OK Boys and Girls, you need to understand something about Chinese food....  The different regions are known for different foods and styles.  You don't go to a place like China First (which is Hong Kong style or Cantonese food) and order pot stickers (which are central/northern).  You DO go to China First for some down home Cantonese classics, such as black bean clams, stirfried beef and broccoli, chow fun, tofu clay pot and the other things that people recommend.  Great place for Chinese comfort food and CHEEP!  Don't expect fine dining, or to see Michael Bauer at the next table, and you won't be disappointed.
author: Priscilla C.

description: this is the worse place. we went there on saturday and wait for almost 2 hours and then when we finally got seated, they ignored us and never even came to our table, but they managed to take the orders of 2 other tables that came after us!!!!!! soooooo rude and inconsiderate. we just got up and walked out, and still they did not even acknowledge us or apologize!!!!!!!!
author: Mimi S.

description: Fresh seasonal veggies, fish tank full of fresh seafood, bomb ass Salt n Pepper Pork, and it's not expensive. What else can you ask for in a Chinese restaurant? Ok, a clean bathroom would be nice, but I've seen worst in national fast-food chains. People who bitch about the service here is tripping, I always found the male service staff to be pleasant and funny, but the lady on the register is a bit cold. She's cold even to me, and I'm pretty damn sexy.
author: Mojo L.

description: Excellent place for lunch and dinner.  They have lots of authentic Chinese favorites in great portions.  I noticed they have an array of seafood specials as well.  Did not order any seafood items since we went during lunch.  With $25, you can feed four adults and feel stuffed.
author: Marilyn Y.

description:
I love this place, I go there whenever I can.  The food is great for such reasonable prices and it's great to bring a large crowd.  My uncle in the east bay comes down just to eat dinner at China First because he says it reminds him of the restaurants in Chinatown when he was growing up.
It's a cool neighborhood restaurant that doesn't rely on stylish decor, oddly shaped plates, or "generic ass names" for its dishes to attract customers
author: James C.

description: China First is good. The chow mein is descent, but not fabulous. The fried rice is FABULOUS! The servers are very attentive and whenever I go here I can always get a table right away!
author: Joe B.

description:
China First is awesome. Huge portions, great menu of awesome dishes and the price is unbeatable. I definitely walked away from there with a warm full tummy and a very happy smile on my face.

The perfect dinner: China First: Deep-fried sanddab, crab, salt n' pepper shrimp, any clay pot, beef chow fun and salty fish n' chicken fried rice. Eat your fill and take the rest home for tomorrow lunch/dinner...walk across the street to Quickly and get a honeydew green tea w/ boba...drive home sipping your boba drink with a huge smile on your face!
author: Ed C.

description:
First off, let me warn you that it's usually hard to find parking in this area especially during the lunch and dinner hours. However, I do think that the food makes up for all the driving around in circles we usually do looking for a parking spot.

Our (my boyfriend and I) order is usually pretty basic. Their egg-drop soup is okay, nothing spectacular. The sweet and sour chicken is tasty, but sometimes it comes out a little cold. The combination pan-fried noodles is pretty good. I must say, my favorite dish here is also one of the most simple. I absolutely love their BBQ pork fried rice, it could be a meal on it's own. 

Basically: Tasty, reasonably priced Chinese food.
author: Rachel D.

description: yummy dinner. specials are in Chinese, but the servers will try to explain them if they speak English.  very crowded and good luck finding parking.
author: Agent X.

description: This place was so bad that today, the morning after, I'm still stifling the gag reflex. Maybe it was the stuff that grandma ordered -- fried squab, deep fried fish bones (that's right: bones. all the meat had apparently been fried off so that it was just bones and batter), some oatmealy soup with questionable meat in it -- but even the service was bad. What I'm saying is this: we sat at a dingy table behind a dirty fish tank eating almost exclusively overly salted deep-fried weirdness (except Buddha's Delight, which had seaweed so fresh it still had sand in it) and left feeling both constipated and about to have explosive diarrhea. The one good thing is that it's cheap. So if you're into puking, it's a pretty good deal.
author: jackie t.

description: this place PWNs. not that big but the place was pretty packed! omg the food was sooo good. one of the best chinese ive had so far. located on clement. clement is THE spot for legit chinese food outside of chinatown. MUST TRY
author: Dennis C.

description: friendly fast service with your orders coming out quick.  fresh seafood like fish, dungeness crab, lobster, and other assorted shell fish.  but the big plus for the non chinese patrons, their secret chinese menu on the walls that are not on the menu, are translated in english.  place is cheap and authentic!
author: Pickle R.

description: Terrific chinese food in a clean, newly renovated space.  The servers understand english, prices are really reasonable and the best part is the special chinese dishes are written in both chinese and english on white boards posted on the restaurant walls.  Every time I've gone to China First there have been multiple tables of Chinese families eating traditional banquet style with 10+ persons at each table - a sure sign that this is a really good restaurant that Chinese families with friends dine at and keep returning to over the years.
author: kristy l.

description: So I was craving Chinese food one night so we went out to the Geary  / Clement area to find some spot that we'd never tried before. Long story short, if you're not looking to spend a lot of money but would love to eat food that tastes much better than the price suggests (5-6 bucks per item), come to this spot. 22.00 with tip fed four people. You do the math.

description: Cheap and reliable chinese food.  My parents LOVE this place, especially the lobster lo mein.  I got tired of going there all the time though, and I find the fare to be a bit on the heavy side (lots of grease).
author: Priscilla P.

description: not a bad place...cant say much about decor and service, but who cares when the food was damn good and at such a decent price.  as i walked in i noticed how frickin busy this place is, meaning this place must be that good.  they have lots of big tables with lazy susans catering to big families.  i was really excited about this meal b/c i was joining my lovely dining companion's family for dinner for the first time.   along with being introduced to them for the first time, i couldnt wait for them to test out what my tastebuds and my gut could handle.  i hoped to try the dishes that i may have not encountered before.  and for the first time i had snails...(i mean ive had escargot before) but snails cooked in black bean sauce.  i was really impressed by this very seasonal dish, so it was my lucky day.  they served the snails with the shell on.  you use toothpicks to loosen them out.  note...make sure before you remove what i call, "the door" or the piece that covers the opening of the snail.  after removing the door and loosening them up, you suck out the those chewy little bastards.  and man they are tasty, so tasty that all flavors of the salty black bean sauce are just swimming in your mouth.  ooh, i had the opportunity to sucking down on a pregnant female snail.  as i started on chewing the lil bastard, it was like i was eating a savory salty chewy nugget of snail stuffed with rice crispies, which were the baby snails.  we also enjoyed the salt pepper fried calamari and chicken wings, and walnut prawns were good.  I also really enjoyed the deep fried tofu.  for dessert there was a red bean dessert. Personally, to complete the finish of such a fine meal,  i would have loved a cream puff----aka beard papa cream puff!!! ha..ha..ha
author: Reggie M.
